reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty-Four, File 23 of 27
title: The LOD Communications Underground H/P BBS Message Base Project: Information and Order Form File Version #2, 7/30/93
historical_context: This article provides insight into the efforts of LOD Communications to preserve the history of underground hacker and phreaker bulletin board systems (BBS) from the 1980s and early 1990s, a time when such communities thrived.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, historians, and anyone interested in the evolution of computer underground culture.
short_summary: This document outlines the LOD Communications project aimed at preserving historical data from underground H/P BBSes. It includes updates on pricing, FAQs, and the significance of the project for various audiences, including researchers and enthusiasts.
summary: The LOD Communications project is a significant endeavor to archive the messages and culture of underground hacker and phreaker bulletin board systems from the early days of personal computing. The document serves as an updated order form and information file, detailing the project's goals, the historical importance of the BBSes involved, and the types of content available. It emphasizes the need for financial support to continue the archiving efforts, highlighting the extensive work required to recover and organize the messages from over 50 BBSes, some dating back to the early 1980s. The article also addresses the various audiences that may benefit from this information, including participants from the era, security professionals, and academic institutions, making it a valuable resource for understanding the evolution of computer culture and security practices.
additional_notes: The document also includes a section on frequently asked questions, clarifying the pricing structure and the types of files available for order, as well as the historical context of the BBSes being archived.
